com.github.timmy80.mia.messaging
 
  • Classes in com.github.timmy80.mia.core used by com.github.timmy80.mia.core
    Class
    Description
    ApplicationContext
    A common context for multiple Task
    Ex : A call on ApplicationContext.stop() will perform a stop on all the Task of this context.
    ApplicationContextParams
    Parameters of an ApplicationContext
    Async.Function1
    A Function that supports Exception
    Async.Function2
    A Function that supports Exception and 2 args
    Async.Function3
    A Function that supports Exception and 3 args
    Async.Function4
    A Function that supports Exception and 4 args
    Async.ThrowingRunnable
    A Runnable that supports Exception
    Async.VoidFunction1
    A void returning Function that supports Exception
    Async.VoidFunction2
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 2 args
    Async.VoidFunction3
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 3 args
    Async.VoidFunction4
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 4 args
    ExecutionStage
    A MiA execution stage.
    LogFmt
    A utility class to create log messages using the Logfmt format.
    Get more info at https://brandur.org/logfmt
    ProbeHandlerTerm
    Base class for a liveness, readiness, ... probe request handling
    ProbesTask
    A task that manages the probes configured on its ApplicationContext
    State
    A very simple base class to create States for Terminal.
    Task
    A MiA task.
    Terminal
    A non Thread Executor which depends on a Task to be executed.
    Creating terminals allows to dispatch the management of complex sub-tasks in a logical context.
    Terminal provides a state mechanism which allows to further dispatch the complexity.

    A Terminal has always a State unless terminated.
    TerminalState
    Base class of a Terminal State
    TimeLimit
    A simple expression of a time limit used for real time applications.
    A TimeLimit less or equal to 0 means no limit.
    TimerTask
    Extend TimerTask to make it a FunctionalInterface
